options.text: Because of mutations on the Y chromosome

options.label: B
options.text: Because of X inactivation and the expression of different X chromosomes

options.label: C
options.text: Because of the interaction between the X and Y chromosomes

multiple-choice.question: What is the reason for the difference in color vision between the identical twins?

options.label: A
options.text: A mutation on the Y chromosome

options.label: B
options.text: A difference in X inactivation patterns

options.label: C
options.text: A mutation on a different chromosome

multiple-choice.question: Why are disorders associated with X chromosome gene mutations often less severe in individuals with two X chromosomes?

options.label: A
options.text: Because the mutant gene is always expressed

options.label: B
options.text: Because only some cells are affected by the mutation

options.label: C
options.text: Because the Y chromosome compensates for the mutation

options.label: D
options.text: Because the X chromosome is not important for development

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the unresolved questions about X inactivation?

options.label: A
options.text: How the Y chromosome influences X inactivation

options.label: B
options.text: How some genes on the X chromosome escape inactivation

options.label: C
options.text: Why X inactivation is always random

options.label: D
options.text: How X inactivation affects the Y chromosome

multiple-choice.question: What is one of the conclusions that can be drawn from the mechanism of X inactivation?

options.label: B
options.text: The Y chromosome is more important than the X chromosome

options.label: C
options.text: Genes alone don't tell our whole story

options.label: D
options.text: X inactivation is the only mechanism that influences trait expression

title: What Can Herpes Do To Your Brain?

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the host of the show "Gross Science"?
How many different types of herpes viruses are known to infect humans?

options.label: A
options.text: They are completely eliminated from the body

options.label: B
options.text: They go into a latent phase, hiding in cells

options.label: C
options.text: They multiply rapidly and cause severe symptoms

options.label: D
options.text: They are only active at night

multiple-choice.question: Where do the herpes viruses that cause cold sores, genital sores, and chicken pox hide in the body?

options.label: B
options.text: In the nervous system, specifically in neurons

multiple-choice.question: What is the name of the disease that can occur when the chicken pox virus flares up later in life?

options.label: C
options.text: Loss of ability to recognize whole classes of things

multiple-choice.question: How often do herpes viruses make their way to the brain and cause complications?
What have scientists recently begun to understand about herpes viruses?

options.label: C
options.text: How to lure them out of the nervous system

title: The three different ways mammals give birth - Kate Slabosky

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary characteristic that distinguishes mammals from other vertebrates?

options.label: C
options.text: Warm blood, body hair or fur, and the ability to breathe using lungs

multiple-choice.question: What is the function of the placenta in placental mammals?

options.label: A
options.text: To produce milk for the young

options.label: B
options.text: To support the developing embryo by funneling nutrients and oxygen

options.label: D
options.text: To aid in the birth process

options.label: A
options.text: They are fully developed and independent

options.label: B
options.text: They continue developing in the mother's pouch

options.label: C
options.text: They are born with a placenta

multiple-choice.question: How much does a newborn quoll typically weigh?
What is the name of the third type of mammal mentioned in the transcript, which lays eggs instead of giving birth to live young?

How do monotreme babies obtain nourishment after hatching from their eggs?

options.label: B
options.text: They suckle milk from pores on their mother's body

options.label: C
options.text: They receive nutrients from a placenta

options.label: D
options.text: They lay eggs of their own

multiple-choice.question: What is unique about the reproductive system of monotremes?

options.label: A
options.text: They have multiple orifices for reproduction, excretion, and egg-laying

options.label: B
options.text: They have a single orifice for reproduction, excretion, and egg-laying

options.label: C
options.text: They give birth to live young

options.label: D
options.text: They do not produce milk for their young

multiple-choice.question: What is a characteristic that all mammals, regardless of their birthing method, share?

options.label: D
options.text: Having a single orifice for reproduction, excretion, and egg-laying

title: Why do we itch? - Emma Bryce

multiple-choice.question: What is the primary function of the anticoagulant released by a mosquito during a bite?

options.label: A
options.text: To trigger the release of histamine

options.label: B
options.text: To prevent the blood from clotting

options.label: C
options.text: To activate the nerves involved in itching

options.label: D
options.text: To accelerate the body's immune response

multiple-choice.question: What is the role of histamine in the body's response to a mosquito bite?

options.label: A
options.text: To prevent the blood from clotting

options.label: B
options.text: To trigger the release of anticoagulant

options.label: C
options.text: To make capillaries swell and accelerate the immune response

options.label: D
options.text: To activate the nerves involved in pain

multiple-choice.question: According to research, how are itch signals transmitted in the skin of mice?

options.label: A
options.text: Via a subclass of nerves associated with touch

options.label: B
options.text: Via a subclass of nerves associated with pain

options.label: C
options.text: Via a subclass of nerves associated with temperature

options.label: D
options.text: Via a subclass of nerves associated with pressure

multiple-choice.question: What molecule is produced by dedicated nerves to trigger the signal that creates the feeling of an itch?
Why does scratching provide relief from an itch?

options.label: A
options.text: Because it removes the source of the itch

options.label: B
options.text: Because it creates a low-level pain signal that overrides the itching sensation

options.label: C
options.text: Because it releases endorphins that reduce pain and itching

options.label: D
options.text: Because it increases blood flow to the affected area

multiple-choice.question: What is the leading theory on the evolutionary purpose of itching?

options.label: A
options.text: To annoy us and make us scratch

options.label: B
options.text: To make us aware of internal threats, such as diseases

options.label: C
options.text: To make our skin acutely aware of touch to deal with external risks

options.label: D
options.text: To accelerate the body's immune response

multiple-choice.question: Why do we not feel itching sensations inside our bodies, such as in our intestines?

options.label: A
options.text: Because the intestines are not sensitive to touch

options.label: B
options.text: Because the intestines are safe from external threats

options.label: C
options.text: Because the intestines have a different type of nerve signaling

options.label: D
options.text: Because the intestines are not connected to the brain

multiple-choice.question: What is delusory parasitosis, and what are its symptoms?

options.label: A
options.text: A psychological condition where people believe their bodies are infested with mites or fleas, causing excessive itching

options.label: B
options.text: A neurological condition where people experience numbness and tingling in their limbs

options.label: C
options.text: A skin condition where people experience dryness and irritation

options.label: D
options.text: A psychiatric condition where people experience hallucinations and delusions

multiple-choice.question: How do doctors treat phantom itching in patients who have had amputations?

options.label: A
options.text: By prescribing medication to block the pathway of the itch

options.label: B
options.text: By using mirrors to reflect the remaining limb, creating an illusion that tricks the brain

options.label: C
options.text: By performing surgery to repair damaged nerves

options.label: D
options.text: By providing physical therapy to improve mobility and reduce itching

multiple-choice.question: What are researchers currently searching for to develop new treatments for itching?

options.label: B
options.text: The molecules involved in pain signaling

options.label: C
options.text: The pathways involved in touch and pressure

options.label: D
options.text: The receptors involved in temperature regulation

title: Can you solve the virus riddle? - Lisa Winer

multiple-choice.question: What event causes the power outage in the lab and the release of the prehistoric virus?

options.label: A
options.text: Entering the room and pulling the emergency self-destruct switch, then exiting without restriction

options.text: Entering the room, pulling the emergency self-destruct switch, and then being unable to re-enter

options.label: D
options.text: Not entering the room at all

options.label: A
options.text: Finding the shortest path in a graph

options.label: B
options.text: Finding a route that visits every point in a graph exactly once

options.label: C
options.text: Finding the minimum spanning tree in a graph

options.label: D
options.text: Finding the maximum flow in a graph

options.label: A
options.text: The rooms form a grid with an odd number of rooms on each side

options.label: B
options.text: The rooms form a grid with an even number of rooms on each side

options.label: C
options.text: The rooms are not connected by airlocks

options.label: D
options.text: The security system is on lockdown

options.label: B

options.label: C
options.text: The ability to destroy the virus in multiple rooms at once

options.label: D
options.text: The ability to bypass the security system

multiple-choice.question: How many options are there for a successful route to destroy the virus after returning to the entrance room?

options.label: A
options.text: Because an even number times an even number is odd

options.label: B
options.text: Because an even number times an even number is even

options.label: C
options.text: Because an odd number times an odd number is even

options.label: D
options.text: Because an odd number times an odd number is odd
